page.title: 01NORTH AND SOUTH RAUCEBY
page.content: North and South Rauceby are seperate villages under one Parish Council. south Rauceby, the larger village, has a population of 389 and the North Rauceby, a hamlet, a population of 197. The South Village has the public house and village hall. The North Village, the Church and its primary school. The area is mainly arable land with some sheep and cattle farming employing about twently persons. The landscape is undulating, dotted with copses and woodland. South Rauceby has many stone built cottages and walls, some still in the ownership of Rauceby Estate. More modern expensive privately owned houses/bungalows on large plots have developed. People not working on the land commute daily to other towns for employment. The R.A.F. Officer Training College, Cranwell, attracts residents to the village and
